Package bomberman.model

Class StandardArena

  • java.lang.Object
    • bomberman.model.StandardArena
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ArenaI
    public class StandardArena
extends java.lang.Object
implements ArenaI
    A standard arena where the borders are undestroyable blocks. Inside the arena there are randomly placed destroyable blocks.
    Author:
    Felix Bachmann

      StandardArena​(int size)
      Creates a new StandardArena with a specific size.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StandardArena

        public StandardArena​(int size)
        Creates a new StandardArena with a specific size.
        Parameters:
        size - The size of the arena to be created. The created arena will have size * size tiles and be quadratic. Has to be at least 4, otherwise an Exception is thrown.

    • Method Detail

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Description copied from interface: ArenaI
        Returns the size of this arena. The arena is quadratic and has size * size tiles.
        Specified by:
        getSize in interface ArenaI
        Returns:
        the size

      • getMaxPlayers

        public int getMaxPlayers()
        Description copied from interface: ArenaI
        Returns the amount of players that are able to play inside this arena.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        the amount of player allowed in this arena

      • getSpawnPoints

        public TileCoordinate[] getSpawnPoints()
        Returns the spawn points for players. At TileCoordinates in the returned array there will be an EmptyTile. Maybe there are also some "buffer" empty tiles so that initial movement is possible. The returned array has a size of getMaxPlayers().
        Returns:
        the spawn points
